org.javaToAvalla.stepFunction.impl

Class StepFunctionReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.javaToAvalla.stepFunction.impl.StepFunctionReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StepFunctionReaderIF

    public class StepFunctionReader
extends Object
implements StepFunctionReaderIF
    The StepFunctionReader class provides functionality to read and parse step function arguments from a file. It uses a lexer and parser generated from the StepFunctionArgs grammar to convert the contents of the file into a list of JavaArgumentTerm objects.

    The file can be specified via a Path, or if no path is provided, the reader uses a default file located in the "input" directory within the project structure.

    • Field Summary

      Default path of the stepFunctionArgs.

    • Method Detail

      • readStepFunction

        public List<JavaArgumentTerm> readStepFunction(Path path)
        Reads a step function definition from the file at the specified path and parses its content to retrieve a list of JavaArgumentTerm objects.

        The method reads the file contents, converts it to a string, and uses the lexer and parser generated from the StepFunctionArgs grammar to walk the parse tree and extract the argument list. If an error occurs while reading the file, it logs the error.

        Specified by:
        readStepFunction in interface StepFunctionReaderIF
        Parameters:
        path - the Path to the file containing the step function definition
        Returns:
        a list of JavaArgumentTerm objects parsed from the file, or an empty list if an error occurs

      • readStepFunction

        public List<JavaArgumentTerm> readStepFunction()
        Reads a step function definition from the file at the default path and parses its content to retrieve a list of JavaArgumentTerm objects. Call the readStepFunction(Path path) method with the DEFAULT_PATH as argument.
        Specified by:
        readStepFunction in interface StepFunctionReaderIF
        Returns:
        a list of JavaArgumentTerm objects parsed from the file, or an empty list if an error occurs
